page.title: 06COFFINSWELL AND SURROUNDINGS
page.content: Coffinswell consists of many fields, with little residential area.The houses that are there are sometimes up to 400 yrs old.Many have thatched roofs and are extremely attractive.The fields are mostly used as rough grazing land.There are also fields containing non-crops and intensively managed grassland (used for making silage and hay).The animals who are kept in this area include sheep,cows and horses.The roads are very narrow yet are still two-way.As you go along there are hedges on either side of you which have to be cut regularly.The hedges contain wild flowers such as Cows Parsley,Honeysuckle,Wild Roses and Campions.These lanes are not smooth as they have a stoney surface. Amenities include 1 public house,1 church and Ashlands boarding kennels and cattery.
